ants

Class AntGameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.TimerTask
      • basis.GameManager
        • ants.AntGameManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class AntGameManager
extends GameManager
    This class is responsible for creating ant games when appropriated. Here, "appropriated" means that bots should have relatively equitable scores and should not wait for too long in the lobby.
    Author:
    Jonathan, Juliette

      • AntGameManager

        public AntGameManager(GameHandler gameHandler,
                      java.util.ArrayList<AntMapTemplate> maps)
        Creates a new game manager for an ant game.
        Parameters:
        gameHandler - the handler used to notify the server when games are created.
        maps - a list of playable maps.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Creates ant game for bots if appropriated. { @code import java.util.timer; Timer timer = new Timer(); long whenToStart = 0; long interval = 3000; timer.scheduleAtFixedRate(gameManager, whenToStart, interval); }
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class GameManager

      • setBotsInFight

        public void setBotsInFight(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Bot>> toFightList,
                           AntMapTemplate map)
        Sets the bots in the list as fighting. Implies resetting the priority, removing them from the map and from the vector of the other bots, and setting their status as inGame.
        Parameters:
        toFightList - a list of games to create/bots associations.
        map - the map on which the bots will fight.

      • addBot

        public void addBot(Bot bot)
        Adds a bot in the game manager specific to the game of ants. If the bot is in training mode, the game manager immediately creates a game for it.
        Overrides:
        addBot in class GameManager
        Parameters:
        the - bot to add in the game manager lobby.
